subject: KOR
name: Beginning Korean I
info: Basic grammatical structure, vocabulary, expressions of modern colloquial Korean. Introduces Korean writing system.

subject: KOR
name: Beginning Korean II
info: Basic grammatical structure, vocabulary, expressions of modern colloquial Korean.prereq: 1011

subject: KOR
name: Accelerated Korean
info: Intensive course. Emphasizes reading/writing. Listening/speaking in various contexts.

subject: KOR
name: Intermediate Korean I
info: Speaking, reading, writing at intermediate level in modern colloquial Korean. Simple narration/written reports. Some basic Chinese characters may be introduced.prereq: 1012

subject: KOR
name: Intermediate Korean II
info: Speaking, reading, writing at intermediate level in modern colloquial Korean. Narration/written reports. Introduction of additional basic Chinese characters.prereq: 3021

subject: KOR
name: Third Year Korean I
info: Speaking, reading, writing at advanced level in modern colloquial Korean. Narration, written reports. Further Chinese characters introduced.prereq: 3022

subject: KOR
name: Third Year Korean II
info: Speaking, reading, writing at advanced level in modern colloquial Korean. Narration, written reports. Further Chinese characters introduced.prereq: 3031

subject: KOR
name: Korean Teaching Tutorial
info: Students tutor beginning students of Korean and are part of department's Korean language team.prereq: Grade of A in 3032

subject: KOR
name: 20th Cent Korean Lit in Trans
info: Various works of Korean literature from colonial age through 1990s. Literary responses to historical changes. Relationship of literary works with historical issues such as colonial experience, Korean civil war and its results, and modern industrial society.

subject: KOR
name: KOR Culture & History
info: Introduction to Korean society/culture. History, material culture, religion, family/kinship, weddings. Lectures, discussions, videos.

subject: KOR
name: Directed Studies
info: Directed study in topics of Korean literature, culture, language, or linguistics.Prereq instr consent, dept consent, college consent.

subject: KOR
name: Beg Korean I for Grad Research
fullname: Beginning Korean I for Graduate Student Research
info: Basic grammatical structure, vocabulary, expressions of modern colloquial Korean. Introduces Korean writing system. Meets with 1011.

subject: KOR
name: Beg Korean II Grad Research
fullname: Beginning Korean II for Graduate Student Research
info: Basic grammatical structure, vocabulary, expressions of modern colloquial Korean. Meets with 1012.prereq: 4001

subject: KOR
name: Int Korean I for Grad Research
fullname: Intermediate Korean I for Graduate Student Research
info: Speaking, reading, writing in modern colloquial Korean. Simple narration/written reports. Basic Chinese characters may be introduced. Meets with 3021.prereq: 4002, grad student

subject: KOR
name: Int Korean II Grad Research
fullname: Intermediate Korean II for Graduate Student Research
info: Speaking, reading, writing at intermediate level in modern colloquial Korean. Narration/written reports. Introduction of additional basic Chinese characters. Meets with 3022.prereq: 4003

subject: KOR
name: Third Yr Korean I Grad Resrch
fullname: Third Year Korean I for Graduate Student Research
info: Speaking, reading, writing in modern colloquial Korean. Narration, written reports. Further Chinese characters. Meets with 3031.prereq: 4004

subject: KOR
name: Third Yr Korean II Grad Resrch
fullname: Third Year Korean II for Graduate Student Research
info: Speaking, reading, writing at advanced level in modern colloquial Korean. Narration, written reports. Further Chinese characters introduced.prereq: 4005

subject: KOR
name: Advanced Korean I
fullname: Advanced Readings in Modern Korean I
info: Speaking, listening, reading, writing. Content/task-based course. Study vocabulary/read novels, journals, selections from Korean history/arts. Writing summaries, reports, simple reaction papers.prereq: 3032 or equiv or instr consent

subject: KOR
name: Advanced Korean II
fullname: Advanced Readings in Modern Korean II
info: Speaking, listening, reading, writing. Content/task-based course. Study vocabulary/read novels, journals, selections from Korean history/arts. Writing summaries, reports, simple reaction papers.prereq: 4041 or equiv or instr consent

subject: KOR
name: Readings in Korean Texts
fullname: Readings in Korean Texts: North Korean Dialect
info: Expose advanced students of Korean to various North Korean contexts. Improve ability to understand North Korean literary work. Various authentic texts from North Korea. Mostly taught in Korean.prereq: 3022 or intermediate level of Korean proficiency

subject: KOR
name: Readings in Sino-Korean Texts
info: Sino-Korean vocabulary/characters necessary for advanced and superior level of knowledge in Korean. Students conduct research projects based on specialized readings in their own fields of study.prereq: 3032 or equiv or instr consent

subject: KOR
name: Introductory Classical Chinese
info: Reading excerpts from canonical Chinese texts. Transnational nature of Classical Chinese/its importance in study of East Asian cultures. Taught in English.prereq: Two years of an East Asian language (Chinese, Japanese, Korean) or equivalent or instr consent

subject: KOR
name: Intro Classical Chinese II
info: Reading excerpts from canonical Chinese texts. Transnational nature of Classical Chinese/its importance in study of East Asian cultures. Taught in English.prereq: 5211 and two years of an East Asian language (Chinese, Japanese, Korean) or equivalent or instr consent

subject: KOR
name: Directed Studies
info: Guided individual study of Korean language or linguistics.prereq: instr consent, dept consent, college consent
